<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr Business Analyst

Location: Las Vegas, NV

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Job Description:

Position Overview

The primary responsibility of the Sr Business Analyst is to develop, plan and implement technology solutions to improve business needs. They are responsible for bridging the gap between IT and the Business using analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver recommendations to executives and stakeholders.

A strong understanding of the technology landscape and industry acumen is necessary to effectively analyze and document business requirements, workflows and use best practices in collaboration with enterprise architects, application developers, consultants, and vendors. This position will require concurrent work on disparate projects, ranging from system implementations to organizational efficiency initiatives to business development opportunities.

The Sr Business Analyst must be able to develop comprehensive requirement documents and process flows, define project scope and objectives, coordinate testing with business stakeholders and Quality Assurance team, conduct and document user acceptance testing, and identify and mitigate risks / issues to deliver the project scope.

The ability to professionally engage and effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, including C-level executives, is a fundamental requirement for this position.

All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Las Vegas Sands’ policies, practices and procedures. All Las Vegas Sands Corp. Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company’s standards, work requirements and rules of conduct.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Document and analyze business systems and user defined needsPartner with business and IT stakeholders to set clear requirements to reach goals and milestonesManage and supervise requirements and changes throughout project lifecyclePlan and coordinate activities around detailed testing validation and execution, user acceptance and transition to operationsEvaluate commercial products against business, technical and resource requirements; determine investment feasibility Ensure delivery of high-quality solutions to the businessDefine project scope to include objectives, added value and benefitsAudit, analyse, and summarize overall performance and provide results during follow-ups and leadership debrief Proactively detect, mitigate and resolve issues and risks; escalate when necessary Execute multiple projects simultaneously without compromise to standards and excellenceDevelop business/financial models and metrics to address business critical issues and prioritizationFacilitate cost and effort estimation sessions with developers and third-party solution providersCommunicate effectively in a multi-cultural, multi-national environment with technical and non-technical teams and executives to drive IT strategy and achieve organizational objectivesValidate deliverables meet organizational and customer scope and quality expectationsIdentify opportunities for execution and process improvement, including policy, standard, and guideline recommendationsFacilitate resolution of audit findings and monitor cyber risk assessment plansBuild strong relationships across all levels of the organization and commercial partnersCommit to excellence, insisting on the highest professional standards, personally and from othersPerform job duties in a safe manner.Attend work as scheduled on a consistent and regular basis.Perform other related duties as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications

At least 21 years of ageProof of authorization to work in the United StatesBachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science or equivalent in a relevant discipline Must be able to obtain and maintain any certification or license, as required by law or policy. 7 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in field of information technology or systems5 years of IT industry or equivalent technical experience (e.g., engineering, software development, networking, etc.)Demonstrated experience in business requirements analysis and documentation, data mapping and test planning, process mappingAdvanced understanding of Agile methodology, BPMN, UML, and user interface designWorking knowledge of process modeling tools and enterprise modelling suitesFamiliar with compliance and privacy regulations such as: PCI, GLBA, SOX, GDPR, Basel III, HIPPA, COPPA, FCRAFamiliar with cyber security technologies and solutionsFamiliar with end user solutions including identity management and user authenticationFamiliar with cloud platform services and their orchestration including, but not limited to, Alibaba, Amazon Web Services, Azure, and Google Cloud PlatformFamiliar with identity strategies and application integrationsFamiliar with technology infrastructure including servers, storage, networking, Wi-Fi, telephony as well as end user computing technologiesMust be able to obtain and maintain a Nevada Gaming Control Board Registration and any other certification or license, as required by law or policy Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experienceAbility to work independently and to effectively manage and execute multiple initiatives concurrentlyWork varied shifts, including nights, weekends and holidaysTravel to international locations for extended periodsMaintain composure under pressureConsistently meet deadlines with internal and external customers and contacts


Physical Requirements

Must be able to:

Physically access assigned workspace areas with or without reasonable accommodation.Work remotely as necessaryWork indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, and dust.Utilize laptop and standard keyboard to perform essential functions of the job.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
